title: Measure In Oregon Could Boost Number Of Registered Voters
teaser: Oregon's governor has signed into law a first-of-its-kind measure that will automatically register eligible voters when they get a driver's license.
contentencoded:
The number of registered voters in Oregon could soon increase dramatically.

Oregon Governor Kate Brown signed into law this week a first-of-its-kind measure that will automatically register eligible voters when they get a drivers’ license and renew their licenses.

Oregon elections officials estimate the new policy will add about 300,000 new voters over the next several years.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Oregon Public Broadcasting’s Chris Lehman reports.
